page.title: 10The Headland Carnival
page.content: {The Headland-H/pool By Dawn Maguire Every year on a Saturday in August there is a{Carnival Parade}on the Headland.Anyone can take part.The{ {Procession}goes by St.Hilda's Hospital ,Friar Terrace,Durham St., Middlegate and Northgate.There are fancy dress and comic groups,and the judging takes place in the Old Friarage Field.There are jazz bands marching up and down the streets and the night before the Carnival there is a beauty competition to find Miss Carnival.One very funny race is the pram race,when one man or women sits in the pram dressed up like a baby and the other pushes the pram down the middle of the street.All the lorries in the parade are decorated, and hundreds of people come to the Headland to watch it.After the parade people go to the fair which is on the Town Moor.
